revised_title: Discovery of Ammonite Vertebrae and Their Fossil Structure
tldr: Mr. Henry Baker and Dr. Miles discovered a unique fossil consisting of 26 joints, which they believe to be the vertebrae of an ammonite. The fossil is made of a sparry substance, and its parts are articulated in an orderly manner. They discuss the possibility of the fossil belonging to Dr. Clark of St. Alban's, found in Oxfordshire, and previously owned by the late Mr. William Becket.
